summary: Saint Martin is an island in the Caribbean, shared by two countries: France and the Netherlands. It's divided into two parts, with the French side being larger but less populated. The Dutch side is more crowded. This split has been there since 1648. The island has a unique history with names like Oualichi and Soualiga. Today, it's known as Saint-Martin / Sint Maarten, and its main airport is Princess Juliana International Airport. The population is around 73,777 people, with more living on the Dutch side.
title: Saint Martin (island)
